intro: Phenax weddellianus, commonly known as the Weddell's fenax, is a flowering plant native to the southern regions of South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton plants. The plant is characterized by its herbaceous growth habit and produces showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that are typically pink or purple in color. It thrives in moist, temperate climates and is often found in wetlands or along riverbanks. Due to its unique appearance and ecological role, it is of interest to botanists and conservationists.
